bibl.author: William Sloane Kennedy
bibl.title: William Sloane Kennedy to Walt Whitman, 3 May 1890
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839-1919, Library of Congress, Washington, DC.

body.p: I notice that Charlie Pfaff is dead. "Brunswick" of the Transcript (who is Mrs Jeanette Gilder) has a word in his memory in Transcript. I am going to stop + see you in July. Love to Dr. Bucke. Blue birds (a pair) building in my box. Also robin + golden woodpecker nesting in lane. What a burst of spring! Am cutting lawn, planting + sowing loving + hating, working + eating + sleeping as usual, always a brave sheers heart Thank you for yr postal bulletin. Your Transcripts you + I pay for by our contributions, that is the agreement.
